alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Campbell; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN BRACKEN, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, NORTHEASTERN PENDLETON, SOUTHEASTERN CLERMONT AND WEST CENTRAL BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Butler, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, penny size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Felicity, Brooksville, Butler, Moscow, Neville, Chilo, Mount Auburn, Willow Grove, Bradford, Powersville, Peach Grove, Ivor, Johnsville, Utopia, Chatham, Woolcutt, Greenwood, Berlin and Parina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
